pageTitle: Transylvania’s Smith & RHIT’s Schiff Claim Men’s Soccer MVPs - Heartland Collegiate Athletic Conference
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {10276=Rose-Hulman's Sean Helliwell has been named the 2012 HCAC Coach of the Year, earning his fourth honor as the head man for the Engineers.  He led Rose-Hulman to a 12-5-3 record this season, earning a share of the HCAC title with an 8-0-1 league mark., 9905=Franklin College's Austin Fundenberger (Indianapolis, Ind./North Central) has been selected as the 2012 HCAC Freshman of the Year.  Fundenberger, a midfielder for the Grizzlies, led the team with six goals and three assists this fall.  The freshman ranked ninth in the HCAC in points (15) and 10th in goals scored., 34225=Copyright 2009 Heartland Collegiate Athletic Conference | Powered by prestosports.com, 8582=GREENWOOD, IN – Transylvania University's Kyle Smith (Cincinnati, Ohio/LaSalle) and Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology's Mike Schiff (Martinsville, Ind./Mooresville) have been named the 2012 Heartland Collegiate Athletic Conference Most Valuable Players on offense and defense respectively.  Smith helped guide the Pioneers to their eighth regular season title and ninth HCAC men's soccer tournament crown, while Schiff led the Engineers to a share of their third HCAC title with an 8-0-1 conference mark.}
textBeforeTable: All-HCAC Team   Coach of the Year: Sean Helliwell, Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology Freshman of the Year: Austin Fundenberger, Franklin College Defensive Most Valuable Player:  Mike Schiff, Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology Offensive Most Valuable Player: Kyle Smith, Transylvania University   Fourteen players join Smith, Schiff, and Fundenberger as All-HCAC First Team members. Those players include Anderson's Brad Rusche (Jr., New Palestine, Ind.), Kingsley Kantande (Sr., Blantyre, Malawi), and Reid Martin (Jr., Seymour, Ind.), Earlham's Frank Mbaya (Jr., Lexington, Ky.), Franklin's Drew Ferguson (Sr., Louisville, Ky.), Hanover's Matt Grau (So., Cincinnati, Ohio), Manchester's Dian Radev (Sr., Burgas, Bulgaria) and Cody Freels (Sr., Auburn, Ind.), Rose-Hulman's Will Senat (Jr., Edmond, Okla.), Drew Belk (Jr., Jasper, Ind.), Marshall Ishmael (Jr., Knoxville, Tenn.), Andrew Bartush (So., Granger, Ind.), and Drew Miller (So., Cincinnati, Ohio), and Transylvania's Taylor Ballard (Jr., Louisville, Ky.). Rose-Hulman's Sean Helliwell has been named the 2012 HCAC Coach of the Year, earning his fourth honor as the head man for the Engineers.  He led Rose-Hulman to a 12-5-3 record this season, earning a share of the HCAC title with an 8-0-1 league mark. Franklin College's Austin Fundenberger (Indianapolis, Ind./North Central) has been selected as the 2012 HCAC Freshman of the Year.  Fundenberger, a midfielder for the Grizzlies, led the team with six goals and three assists this fall.  The freshman ranked ninth in the HCAC in points (15) and 10th in goals scored. Schiff was named
textAfterTable: Second Team All-HCAC Elliot Reiff Anderson Sophomore Back Indianapolis, Ind. Chris Maloney Anderson Sophomore Goalkeeper Avon, Ind. Jordan Andrews Bluffton Sophomore Midfield Clinton Township, Mich. Ryan Johnson-Evers Bluffton Freshman Back Muskego, Wis.
